website_summaries.verdict: It's no bargain, but anyone looking for a Windows alternative to a 13-inch MacBook Pro should start their search with the Razer Blade Stealth.
pros: The 2019 Razer Blade Stealth cleans up nicely with a new streamlined design and a smaller, lighter body and the option for a beautiful color-calibrated 4K UHD display and discrete graphics
cons: It's expensive, particularly with the 4K display and discrete graphics, both of which hurt battery life

customer_reviews.title: One month of heavy usage
customer_reviews.text: Overall happy with the purchase. There are a few disappointments as well. On the positive: 1. Sturdy build 2. Doesn't run too hot 3. Good value 4. Low power draw allows it to charge on airplane Issues: 1. Left type-c port rarely works, support forums confirm 2. Synapse software so buggy, does not detect components 3. Matte finish just shows grease / fingerprints
customer_reviews.author: J. Rule

customer_reviews.title: The perfect 13in laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have had most of the available 13in laptops on the market (Macbook Pro 13 and 15, XPS 13, Spectre X360, X1 Carbon, past Razer Blade Stealth models, etc) and this one stands above all of them. The value proposition compared to Apple products is incredibly strong, while also offering a matte display, substantially better performance, user upgradability, and similar build quality. I can't say anything bad about this machine. Everything from the wifi performance and thermal solution to the sleek and minimalist design, Razer hit it out of the park!
customer_reviews.author: Vertice

customer_reviews.title: Very good! ...but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I did allot of reasearch and it came down to either this or the Matebook X Pro. I was basically looking for the most powerful 13-14 inch laptop that could be charged with USB C. Lets keep it simple... Pros: Keyboard, trackpad, windows hello, build quality(!), overall sexyness, performance is solid Cons: Fan is a bit loud, battery not as good as I had hoped, speakers no better than my xps15 work laptop Reasons I chose it over the matebook: Web cam location, looks of the laptops, Razer 13 is about 15-20% more powerful, from the prices I had it was only about 15% more expensive too.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware Black screen of death after 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst laptops I've ever owned. Love Razer products and took a gamble on this, big mistake. After 2 days of use I have a black screen and its unuseable. Apparently you can send it in and they will fix it, but I'm just returning this junk. When I spend $1300 I expect a functional laptop right away.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Myers

customer_reviews.title: Hot product
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the last Blade Stealth one I owned this one is above and beyond. Working on the machine was awesome, Gaming on the machine is slick (using Razer Core X) Super portable and durable I get around 6h of battery life by just doing nothing, 4h when working, I would prefer more but it is not the end of the world. To Razer, keep it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's going back after hours and hours of trying to fix the 2 finger scroll jumping screen. So sad :(
customer_reviews.text: After hours and hours of downloading, wiping, installing, and reinstalling drivers, we gave up and ordered a 13" Macbook Pro. Despite the high number of low rating reviews we honestly wanted to give this awesomely sleek looking Razer Blade Stealth 13 Ultrabook laptop a chance. We really, really, hoped that we would get a good one. Yes, on paper it looks like the Macbook Pro killer but due to this one major 2 finger scroll jumping screen bug, it unfortunately is NOT. At this price point, shouldn't Quality Control be a priority??? So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Molina Fam

customer_reviews.title: Got it on Sale for 1399.99
customer_reviews.text: Its a great laptop, I bought this for school. I dont really like the right shift key, but Im sure I will get use to it. I have a desktop PC that performs waaaay better, but I needed something on the go. I would not use this laptop as a daily driver, but it is great for on the go, school work and so on. When I get some time with it, I will post my personal benchmarks and thoughts.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: The reviews you will see on this product are from individuals seeking a small laptop to game or perform feats that a larger laptop or desktop would be required for. This laptop is portable, speakers are great, the MX150 performs well in lower settings on even this generation of games. However there are some limitations with game use. For this laptop you will want the 16GB model. The 8GB model will not give you the power needed to do some programs that a game laptop could do. Great laptop, works exactly as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Super Portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop for portability and some gaming, but if you're gonna buy this for the purpose of gaming, then forget about it, even low settings of league of legends lags, the fps drops fast even with the nvidia Mx150. But all in all it's awesome! you can buy 30w charger from anker and it's like the size of your phone charger, you can also charge your phone using the same charger (USB C).
customer_reviews.author: Genos54

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop ever built.
customer_reviews.text: Top notch product with perfect finishing touch. Every detail of the CNC aluminum chassis fit perfectly. The screen color is even better compare to a dell u2414h. Light and thin for easy traveling for work and powerful enough for light gaming at anywhere. I owned a Blade Stealth 2016 then I replace it with a XPS13, HP envy13 then lenovo 530s but those laptops all lacking something that I decided to sell after a few month. Finally I come back to Razer and bought this beauty last month. The moment it arrived I knew that it would be my trusted companion for some next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Valliena

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Battery life has been about 4 hours on a good day, that is with all the latest drivers and updates. Out of the box, the rubber on the bottom of the laptop was uneven and cause the laptop to tilt. I needed something for work right away otherwise I would have sent this pile of garbage back. $600 cheaper than a Surfacebook 2 so I figured I would try it out. Wish I would have stuck with a surfacebook. Will never buy anything from this manufacturer again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: shift key in wrong position
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely difficult and tiresome to type anything on this keyboard due to the off kilter position of shift key. You end up hitting the up arrow every time. The computer is amazing otherwise. That one shift key though. Even as I write this review, I continue to be pained by this shift key. It is endless and time consuming. There are many seconds of my all too brief life now lost to retyping. This really should not have passed the beta test. Also, the function sound and lighting buttons should have been combined with the arrows since they were important enough to move aside the shift key.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Awful battery
customer_reviews.text: I simply cannot recommend this laptop due to awful battery life. Early reviews indicated that they had finally gotten to all day battery life on the stealth, bit even with extreme battery saving measures I barely get 4 hours of basic web browsing and office use. This makes it incredibly frustrating as a work machine, which was my primary use case. I regret selling my surface laptop 2 to get this device. The dedicated GPU does not make up for the vastly diminished battery, not to mention the increased weight.
customer_reviews.author: Welshy

customer_reviews.title: Hands down my favorite laptop
customer_reviews.text: I own several MacBooks and the Razer Blade 15". I had my eyes on the 13" in version for a while and don't regret the purchase. The build quality is superior and the screen is amazing. With 16GB of Ram and a 1 TB drtive, this has become my road warrior machine. It's not a gaming machine by any means - not with the MX150 graphics card anyway, but for gaming I connect it to the Razer Core with a 1080TI in it and its' fairly capable. This replaced my MacBook Pro 13" which was used for software development. Call me a convert, the Razer delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Kai C. Pradel

customer_reviews.title: Well documented fatal flaw: Battery drains while plugged in
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is great. It has everything I wanted: a powerful laptop yet slim and attractive. Unfortunately the included charger is underpowered, so when you’re gaming with the laptop plugged in the laptop battery drains instead of charging. Imagine my surprise when I got low battery warnings while gaming plugged in. So I did some research only to find this is a common problem due to Razer cheaping out on the charger included with the laptop. I’m returning it as this is not functional as is.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with laptop

The track pad took some time for me to get use to coming fro the MacBook but I kinda already thought it would be.

Now, the enter key is broken. Assuming they didn't use the butterfly keys that Apple uses. It very disappointing because my computer is docked most of the time so I am using an external. Summary, spend a little more and get a better machine. DO NOT buy this computer.

customer_reviews.title: Continued Freezing and Crashing.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this laptop. I finally thought I found the ultimate gaming/work combo. Unfortunately I have been plagued with issues on this from freezing, to crashing, to high throttling with only light web browsing, declined gaming performance, to key issues, to the camera not working. It's never the same issue and Razer's only solutions is to continuously factory reset the laptop. The crashing is the worst as each time the error code is something different. I will be returning and finding a solution that is easily more reliable and far more affordable.

customer_reviews.title: Best 13" for gaming ever made.

I did mine using throttle stop with bot cpu and chace at - 120 mv. This stabilized my cpu frequency .
